action.action-desc: Mr. Capuano introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to prohibit funding under the Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance grant program and the Public Safety and Community Policing grant program to be provided to law enforcement agencies that use license plate readers unless certain conditions are met.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Reasonable Policies on Automated License Plate Readers Act.

section.header: Funding under Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance grant program and Public Safety and Community Policing grant program prohibited for use by law enforcement agencies that use license plate readers unless certain conditions met

subsection.header: Restriction under Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance Grant Program
subsection.text: Section 501(d) of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 (42 U.S.C. 3751(d)) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: Any funds or other assistance to a law enforcement agency that uses an automated license plate reader, unless such law enforcement agency has developed written and binding policies for the use of the reader that ensure data collected by the reader—

subparagraph.text: is not stored for a period exceeding 48 hours unless the data is being used in an active law enforcement investigation;
is not stored in a statewide database or other database that consolidates data from such readers; and
is shared with an entity other than the law enforcement agency that operates the reader only if—

clause.text: the entity is another law enforcement agency;
the data is to be used in an active law enforcement investigation; and
the data is provided in response to a specific request for the data.

subsection.header: Restriction under Public Safety and Community Policing grant program
subsection.text: Section 1701 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 (42 U.S.C. 3796dd) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b), by striking The purposes and inserting Subject to subsection (l), the purposes; and
by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, no funds provided under this part may be provided to or used, directly or indirectly, by a law enforcement agency that uses an automated license plate reader, unless such law enforcement agency has developed written and binding policies for the use of the reader that ensure data collected by the reader—

paragraph.text: is not stored for a period exceeding 48 hours unless the data is being used in an active law enforcement investigation;
is not stored in a statewide database or other database that consolidates data from such readers; and
is shared with an entity other than the law enforcement agency that operates the reader only if—

subparagraph.text: the entity is another law enforcement agency;
the data is to be used in an active law enforcement investigation; and
the data is provided in response to a specific request for the data.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to funds provided for grant periods beginning on or after the date that is 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.

Except as provided in subsection (b), no Federal law enforcement agency may use an automated license plate reader, unless such law enforcement agency has developed written and binding policies for the use of the reader that ensure data collected by the reader—

paragraph.text: is not stored for a period exceeding 48 hours unless the data is being used in an active law enforcement investigation;
is not stored in a statewide database or other database that consolidates data from such readers; and
is shared with an entity other than the law enforcement agency that operates the reader only if—

subparagraph.text: the entity is another law enforcement agency;
the data is to be used in an active law enforcement investigation; and
the data is provided in response to a specific request for the data.

subsection.text: Any data collected by the reader at a international border crossing of the United States.
